Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BmKn2-7K (BmKn2 lysine analog, synthetic AMPs20a, Lys-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Luo X, Ye X, Ding L, Zhu W, Yi P, Zhao Z, Gao H, Shu Z, Li S, Sang M, Wang J, Zhong W, Chen Z. 2021
Literature.Title: Fine-Tuning of Alkaline Residues on the Hydrophilic Face Provides a Non-toxic Cationic alpha-Helical Antimicrobial Peptide Against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.62%) toBmKn2K7K: 38%, I: 23%, L=F: 15%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC 29212 or MRSA (MIC 5 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 2.5-5.0 ug/ml),  E. faecalis (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), E. faecium (MIC 5 ug/ml), and E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 5 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: acted on bacterial membranes.Structure: random coil in water and become helical in 30% or 70% TFE.In vitro toxicity: HC50 > 100 ug/ml. 10% hemolysis at 100 ug/ml, less hemo.lytic. This lysine analog is much less hemolytic than the arginine analog (this study) since arginine is more hydrophobic (Mishra et al., 2013). In addition, the peptide is not toxic to human HEK293T and mouse fibroblast cells L929.In vivo toxicity:mouse: 80 mg/kg caused 50% animal death.Animal model:mouse: ip infected S. aureus or A. baumannii, 0.5 hpi, IP treated 20 mg/kg, all mice surviced during 7 days observation (ctr group died in 24 h). Thus, the peptide protected mice from death and also reduced CFU in peritoneal fluids.
